title: Plank
description: Begin in Downward Facing Dog. Bring your hands as wide as your shoulders and feet as wide as your hips. Spread your fingers wide. Reach your tailbone toward the sky behind you. With an inhale, shift forward into Plank, bringing your shoulders over your wrists. Engage your core and legs. Gaze diagonally downward. Hold the pose and take slow, deep breaths. Push back to Downward Facing Dog with an exhale. Hands shoulder-width apart Draw belly toward spine Keep head in line with spine Modification: Lower your knees to the floor.
alignment_cues: Maintain steady breath throughout the pose
Keep proper alignment based on pose type
Listen to your body and modify as needed
